title: Journey Orchestration Step Event Common Fields
description: This Mixin contains the common Journey Metadata information.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: Journey Orchestration for creating user journey
entrance
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: True if the step event was an entrance event for a profile(s). E.g: A step event corresponding to the first event trigger for a unitary journey and scheduled/business event trigger for a batch flow will have this field set to true.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: reentrance
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Set to true of the initial step event for this journey entrance has been triggered by a profile that has already finished one journey instance and is re-entering new journey instance.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: instanceEnded
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: True if the current step led to ending an instance of the journey, that is the last step in a journey for a given profile was executed successfully.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: eventID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: If the step was triggered by an external event, this field will contain the eventID used by journey runtime to identify the event.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: nodeID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: GUID of the node as generated on the journey canvas corresponding to this step(multiple steps can map to the same node).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: stepID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: GUID corresponding to each step generated. Unique across all steps.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: stepName
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Name of the step as represented internally in Journey Runtime.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: stepType
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Defines different types of steps as represented internally by Journey Runtime. Possible Values: ActionStep(Default Step Type),ConditionalRouterStep(If step involved evaluating a condition),SegmentTriggerReadStartStep(If the current step started the segmentTriggeredRead).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: stepStatus
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Gives the current state of the step that has finished executing. Possible Values: Transitions(Next step will occur on an event transition),EndStep(The last step in this journey instance has executed),Error(This step encountered an error condition, ending the current journey instance), TimedOut(The current step has ended because of a timeout on a fetch or on an action.)

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: journeyID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: GUID generated to uniquely identify an authored journey inside the JO Runtime.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: journeyVersionID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: GUID generated to uniquely identify a journey on the authored UI. A new journey version ID is generated if a journey is duplicated or its new version is published.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: journeyVersionName
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Name of the journey as shown on the authoring UI.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: journeyVersion
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: The authored version of the journey. E.g: 1.0, 2.0.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: instanceID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: GUID for each instance of the journey. For each profile entering a journey, a new instance is created.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: externalKey
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Contains the profileID of the profile the current unitary journey instance is executing for. This field was added to support ID’s other than AEP Profile.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentStepID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: stepID of the previous step in the current journey instance.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentStepName
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: stepName of the previous step in the current journey instance.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentTransitionID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Contains the transitionID of the transition that led to the current step. Set to “on-error” if the transition to the current step was because of an error.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentTransitionName
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Name of the transition which has brought the instance to the processed step.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: inTest
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: True if the journey instance was executed in test mode.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: processingTime
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Time(ms) taken to complete the processing of this step.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: instanceType
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Specifies if the journey instance corresponds Unitary(a single profile) or Batch(a journey instance executes a batch of profiles, E.g: Read Segment Journey).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: batchRecurrenceIndex
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: A counter that increases by 1 each time a batch journey is invoked. Likewise in case of business events, it will show the E.g: If a freshly authored scheduled journey runs at 8.00am,then batchRecurrenceIndex=1 and then at 10.00am, then batchRecurrenceIndex=2.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: batchToUnitary
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: (Deprecated)Indicates if this unitary instance has been triggered from a batch instance.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: batchExternalKey
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Journey Version ID in case of scheduled, business key in case of the business event journey (productId in case of a journey triggered by a business event). This field is only available in the context of the unitary step.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: batchInstanceID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: GUID created at invocation of each new batch instance for a journey. E.g: If a scheduled journey runs at 8.00am and 10.00am, there will be two separate different batchInstanceID’s.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: batchUnitaryBranchID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: (Deprecated) If the instance has been triggered from a batch instance, unitary branch ID.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: nodeName
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Name of the node corresponding to this step as visible on the Canvas.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: journeyNodeProcessed
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: A node authored on the journey canvas can be expanded to multiple nodes inside the JO Runtime. This field is set to True when all the steps related to a journey node on canvas have been successfully processed inside the JO Runtime.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: eventProcessed
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Set to true when the step event corresponding to the external event has been processed fully. The presence of this field denotes that the event node in the journey canvas has been processed fully.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: originJumpJourneyID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: JourneyID of the first journey instance that had a jump action that led to the current journey instance. Only present if this journey was triggered by a journey jump action.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: originJumpJourneyVersionID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: JourneyVersionID of the first journey instance that had a jump action that led to the current journey instance. Only present if this journey was triggered by a journey jump action.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: originJumpJourneyInstanceID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: JourneyInstanceID of the first journey instance that had a jump action that led to the current journey instance. Only present if this journey was triggered by a journey jump action.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: previousJumpJourneyID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: JourneyID of the previous journey instance that had the jump action that led to the current journey instance. Only present if this journey was triggered by a journey jump action.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: previousJumpJourneyVersionID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: JourneyVersionID of the previous journey instance that had the jump action that led to the current journey instance. Only present if this journey was triggered by a journey jump action.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: previousJumpJourneyInstanceID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: JourneyInstanceID of the previous journey instance that had the jump action that led to the current journey instance. Only present if this journey was triggered by a journey jump action.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: reactionActionID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: actionID of corresponding action to which the reaction occurred. Present if the current step is triggered as a result of a reaction.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: reactionChannel
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Channel of the corresponding reaction. E.g: Email, Push

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: reactionInteractionType
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: The user interaction that led to this reaction. E.g: Open, Click.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentTransitionType
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Whether the transition to current step occurred because of an event, action or normal flow. Possible Values:Event Triggered(if an event trigger led to the current step),Condition Triggered (if a condition evaluation led to the current step),Basic(if the current step occurred normallly as the next step in the journey).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: nodeType
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Type of the node as authored on the canvas. E.g: action, segmentTrigger, end. There is a sentinel node before the initial node of the authored journey for which nodeType=start.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentNodeID
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: nodeID of the previous step in the current journey instance.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentNodeType
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: nodeType of the previous step in the current journey instance.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: parentNodeName
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: nodeName of the previous step in the current journey instance.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: isExternalEvent
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: Set to true when the event that triggered this step was external to JO.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.title: eventName
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/journeyO.description: If the step was triggered by an external event, this field will contain the name of the event authored on Journey Canvas.
